channel.title: CVE Feed for VMware -- VMware vCenter Server (vCenter Server)
channel.description: The latest CVEs for VMware -- VMware vCenter Server (vCenter Server)

item.title: CVE-2023-20892|2024-08-02T09:21:33.432Z -- vmware -- vmware%20vcenter%20server%20%28vcenter%20server%29
item.description: The vCenter Server contains a heap overflow vulnerability due to the usage of uninitialized memory in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may exploit heap-overflow vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the underlying operating system that hosts vCenter Server.

item.title: CVE-2023-20893|2024-08-02T09:21:33.325Z -- vmware -- vmware%20vcenter%20server%20%28vcenter%20server%29
item.description: The VMware vCenter Server contains a use-after-free vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code on the underlying operating system that hosts vCenter Server.

item.title: CVE-2023-20894|2024-08-02T09:21:33.718Z -- vmware -- vmware%20vcenter%20server%20%28vcenter%20server%29
item.description: The VMware vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bound write by sending a specially crafted packet leading to memory corruption.

item.title: CVE-2023-20896|2024-08-02T09:21:33.642Z -- vmware -- vmware%20vcenter%20server%20%28vcenter%20server%29
item.description: The VMware vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds read vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds read by sending a specially crafted packet leading to denial-of-service of certain services (vmcad, vmdird, and vmafdd).

item.title: CVE-2023-20895|2024-08-02T09:21:33.371Z -- vmware -- vmware%20vcenter%20server%20%28vcenter%20server%29
item.description: The VMware vCenter Server contains a memory corruption vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger a memory corruption vulnerability which may bypass authentication.
